intro: Calamaria cubana, commonly known as the Cuban calamaria, is a unique plant native to the island of Cuba. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture, while its flowers are known for their fragrance and nectar production. Calamaria cubana plays an important ecological role by attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
